Interface Scoreable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Basketball, Football, Hockey, Soccer, TeamInfo
public interface Scoreable
The Scorable interface defines all the behaviors that can be implemented by any of the classes in the hierarchy.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addScore​(int scoringMethod, java.lang.String homeOrAwayTeam)
    takes the method that was done to score and the team that scored and adds the points to it

  • Method Details

    • addScore

      void addScore​(int scoringMethod, java.lang.String homeOrAwayTeam)
      takes the method that was done to score and the team that scored and adds the points to it
      Parameters:
      scoringMethod - is the way something was scored, i.e. touchdown, 3-pointer, etc
      homeOrAwayTeam - the team that scored whose score needs to be updated

    • getScoringMethods

      int getScoringMethods​(int userInput)
      getScoringMethods returns the scoring methods for the particular game selected by the user
      Parameters:
      userInput - is whatever game was selected
      Returns:
      scoring methods for that particular game

    • getPeriodLength

      int getPeriodLength()
      getPeriodLength
      Returns:
      the length of the period of the particular game selected so we can keep tracking while they are playing

    • setCurrentPeriod

      void setCurrentPeriod​(int period)
      setCurrentPeriod is used to start the period at 0 and increment it when the user inputs that the period it over.
      Parameters:
      period - is the input indicating that the period it over.

    • getPeriodName

      java.lang.String getPeriodName()
      getPeriodName
      Returns:
      the type of period for that particular game

    • getCurrentPeriod

      int getCurrentPeriod()
      getCurrentPeriod
      Returns:
      the current period to be outputted to the user

    • endPeriod

      void endPeriod()
      endPeriod is used when the user indicates they want to go to the next period

    • startGame

      void startGame()
      startGame is used to set the period and team names

    • getHomeScore

      int getHomeScore()
      Returns:
      the home team score

    • getAwayScore

      int getAwayScore()
      Returns:
      the away team score

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      terminates the game if the current period is greater than the amount of periods in a game
      Returns:
      true or false

    • getWinningTeam

      java.lang.String getWinningTeam()
      after the game is over getWinningTeam
      Returns:
      the winning team
